Key:
(That afternoon, in between classes—no, even
during classes—I explained the situation to
each girl, hoping to improve their moods.)

(But it took my entire day, right up to when
school ended.)
Maria, are you there?
Yes, I am.
Thank goodness. You came after all.

However, why did you ask me to meet you
behind the school?

Um, it could be chaotic if we're seen together
again.

While that may be true, could we not have
met somewhere outside in the first place?

Yeah, but you don't have a cellphone or
anything, right Maria? If something were
to happen, it might be hard to reach you.
I see. That is true.

Well, that's how it is, so let's head out the
back gate.

Yes. This means you will go on a date with
me as well today, yes?
Yup, that's right. Let's have a date.

(I'm worried about the other Spirits, and for
now I'll prioritize Maria. I do want clues on
how to escape this world, too.)

(Moreover, I want to show Maria even more
things.)

So today, I thought we could head near the
train station and look at all of the shops.
What do you say?
Yes. I look forward to it.
I see. Then, let's go.
They have such a vast selection of items.

Right? See anything that catches your
eye?
Everything looks so enticing. What is this one?

I think that's a coaster? You rest your cups
on top of them.

My records indicate that they are normally
composed of paper or cloth, but it appears
some are made with metal as well.
Sure, but those aren't too common.
Shido, would this coaster be made of paper?

Lemme see... This is a menko. Kind of a strange
thing to be selling still. Who still uses menkos?

Menko, you said? From what I see, it is a toy.
Although it seems one could use it as a coaster
too. Can you not rest your cup upon it?

Technically you could, but... that's not what
it was made for.

How peculiar. While their intended purposes
are different, are they not used similarly for
functional reasons?

No, I don't think so. It's like you said, Maria,
it's the thickness of the menko's paper that
makes it similar to a coaster.

With their similarities, one could be used as
a substitute for the other. A simple concept,
but quite amazing.

It is. Japanese people seem to value that
quality too. In fact Maria, if there's something
you wanna get, just tell me. I'll buy it for you.
For now, I will refrain.
You don't have to hold back, ya know?

No. I have never been shopping before, so
when asked to buy something suddenly, I
am at a loss for what to buy.

I guess that's true. Then, if you find anything,
tell me, okay?
Okay.

Cool. Next time we come here, let's invite the
others to come with us.
The others? Why should we?

It's fun to browse when everyone's pointing
things out, you know? Besides, I gotta make it
up to them somehow. Since it's my fault.
...Yes. I would like to experience that.
Right. Then, let's do that. It's a promise.
Yes, it is a promise.
Welcome!

This is a clothing shop, yes? Do you plan on
buying clothes here?

No, I didn't have anything in mind. I just
figured girls liked looking around in stores
like this.
It is very interesting.
I see. That's good then.

(As I thought, Maria spent time looking through
every nook and cranny of the shop. I'll leave
her be.)

Are you siblings? Your younger sister there is
adorable.
Huh? Er, ha ha ha...
If you'd like, I can search for something.

Um. Sorry, we're just looking around to get
an idea.

I see. If you find something you like, please
call me.
What were you speaking about?

Apparently, that person thought we were
siblings.
Siblings?

Yeah. Guess so. Even though we look nothing
alike. Well, that store clerk is an NPC, so it
might be an automated response or something.
Hmm?
No. It is nothing. Let us go, Shido.

(Maybe it's my imagination, but ever since
we left the store, Maria's been quiet... It's
a little awkward.)
Maria, where to next... Hm?

(On the poster, there were a man and a woman
smiling, locked in embrace. Is it a romance?
...This is perfect.)
Maria. Let's go to that movie theater.
Movie... Right now?

(In a theater, awkward silences can be smoothed
over. When it's over, I bet her mood will be
better.)

Yeah. Seems like a short movie. Shouldn't take
more than an hour. It won't be that late.
I understand.
...I was tricked.

(There were some romantic scenes, but it was
a horror movie. What the hell was up with that
poster...?)
Sorry, Maria. You okay...?
Yes, but that was rather intense...

Yeah. It took me for a ride too. All right,
then. Let's go.
Yes. Um, Shido...?
What's wrong?
Would it be okay to lock arms while we walk?
Walk with locked arms.
Walk with hands held.
All right, here. Grab on.
Yes. Thank you.

(Maria timidly wraps her arm around mine,
and we begin to walk.)

Sorry. I didn't expect it to be that kind of
movie. Did you have a bad time?
No, that is not the case.
Huh? Then, why...?

Even like this, do you think we look like
siblings?
...Huh?
(What? Could it be...?)

Maria, was your reason for looking at the
movie poster not because you wanted to
see the film, but instead...

Because the man and woman were linking
arms.

(It's true, they had a romantic side plot in
the story.)

(Which means the reason Maria wanted
to link arms wasn't because she was scared.)
Shido, how do you see us right now?
W-Well, hahaha... I wonder.

(Siblings who walk with linked arms...
aren't exactly uncommon, I suppose.)
Sorry, Maria. Then, why don't we hold hands?
Hold... hands?
Yeah. Do you not want to, Maria?

I am not opposed to it. In fact, I am glad.
But, this is...
Hm? What's wrong?

Would it not appear like a younger sister being
pulled around by her older brother?
Huh? Um, I don't think so?

Maria, is what that person said at the store
still bothering you?

That is not the case, but if we are on a date,
then I wish to look like a couple.

Hm. Well, I don't think it matters what other
people think, you know? We are who we are.
Their opinion doesn't change anything.

Is that so? Couldn't one say that the first time
an outsider acknowledges your relationship is
when it becomes official?
Hm. Is it... really like that? I don't think so.
Very well. You are surprisingly cold, Shido.

C-Cold... I didn't mean it the way it might
have come out.

No, you are cold. You are like ice. Surely
your mind and body are similarly frigid.
C'mon, now... Hm. Here, take my hand.
Ah...
Isn't it warm?
Yes, very warm.
(I took Maria's hand, and started walking.)
Where do you want to go next?

Let me see. If we are going to have dinner,
there is a restaurant I have been wanting to
try.

I have seen one near the station that offers
a full-course special, popular amongst couples.

Huh?! That's a little... Sorry, but I don't have
that kind of cash in my wallet.
Hee hee.
That was just a joke, Shido.
Ah, Maria... You were kidding me?

Hee hee. I apologize. For some reason, I
wanted to pull a fast one on you.

Well, that's okay, but I'm surprised to see
you attempt a joke, Maria.
Really?

Yeah. It was unexpected.
...So, where do you really want to go?
Let me see...

Why not find a place where the two of us
can relax?
Relax... That isn't some euphemism, right?
...? What do you mean?
Err, sorry. Forget about it...

It's fine. Wait, let's try stopping by Takadai
Park before going home. We can relax there.
If we go now, we'll make it in time for sunset.
Yes. Then let us go.
Now then, let's go home, Maria.
Um, Shido. Today was fun.

Yeah. I had fun, too. To be honest, I'm kinda
exhausted.

(While taking a stretch, I gazed out at the
sunset. So much has happened over the course
of the day.)
What a beautiful sunset.

Yes, it is. The sky is gorgeous. I can feel
it inside me.

The sky seems to go on forever. I'm trapped
in this world, aren't I? It doesn't feel that way
at all.
Do you wish to return to the real world, Shido?

Yeah. I do. I can't stay like this forever, after
all.
This is true...
The real world, huh?

(It's fine if things go back to normal,
but then... What would happen to Maria?)
(Will she end up alone in this world?)

(If that's the case, I wonder what I should do
to save Maria.)
Shido, we should go home.
Hm...? Ahh, you're right.

(No. If everything within the game is fixed,
then we should be able to log in at any time.
If that works, then we can still visit Maria.)
All right. Let's go home. To our house.
Yes. Let us return.

(Maria answered, and for a moment, I thought
I saw a hint of loneliness in her eyes.)
